id: Quiz Night-Archie Brothers Cirque Electriq Wellington, 1 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Archie Brothers Cirque Electriq Wellington, 1 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington
description:
Kicking off at 6pm, gather your crew and come along to two hours of quizzing, with some amazing prizes on offer!
With five rounds of big screen trivia, you and your squad will negotiate engaging, relevant and left-field questions that you have a fighting chance to get correct, regardless of your background or how many Masters degrees you have.
In addition to the epic trivia, we've got get-up-out-of-your-seat games The Line Up and Last Person Standing to mix things up.
If that wasn't good enough, it's Happy Hour between 5:30pm-6:30pm, so come in early to settle in!
Hosted by Malcolm, it's the place to be every Tuesday night!

id: Jewellery Making - Faceted Gemstone Settings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Jewellery Making - Faceted Gemstone Settings
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Description In this challenging and exciting workshop students will learn to set glimmering round-cut faceted gemstones into brass, copper and/or silver.
Students with prior Flush Setting and soldering experience may advance to other methods and to try their hand at learning ‘Bead Setting’, or a simple form of ‘Prong Setting’.
The workshop is especially satisfying for the magpie in all of us, adding extra colour and shine to jewellery making.
By the end of the course, students will be able to: Develop jewellery making skills with introductory faceted stone setting methods Create a simple stone set project - either earrings, a pendant, or a ring.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Moon Open Decks - hosted by Gandoof-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Moon Open Decks - hosted by Gandoof
venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
description:
Moon Open Decks!
DJs & producers of all experience levels are welcome to come & share their tunes

id: Tīnui Emergency Response Practice-Tinui War Memorial Hall, 3 Black Hill Road, , Masterton-Event Finder
name: Tīnui Emergency Response Practice
venue: Tinui War Memorial Hall, 3 Black Hill Road, , Masterton
description:
A Community Emergency Hub is a place for the community to gather and coordinate efforts to help each other during and after a disaster.
Come along and find out more about the Tīnui Community Emergency Hub and the types of help that may be needed after an emergency.
Have fun meeting together and practicing various roles with an interactive earthquake scenario.
Open to all ages and abilities, no experience needed!
Refreshments provided.

id: Retirement Reinvented-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Retirement Reinvented
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms.
(NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).
What’s next?
After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement.
By the end of the day, you’ll have: - Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you - Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths - Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them - Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan - Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose Bring a pen and paper.

id: Drag Brunch Club: Divas through the Decades-The Garden Hotel, 63 Courtenay Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Drag Brunch Club: Divas through the Decades
venue: The Garden Hotel, 63 Courtenay Place, Wellington
description:
Join us for a dazzling Drag Brunch celebrating the fiercest icons in music history!
Divas Through the Decades is a glittering tribute to the legendary women who shaped the soundtrack of our lives— from disco queens to pop powerhouses, our performers will serve high energy, fierce looks, and unforgettable tributes to the legendary divas that defined every era.
Paired with delicious brunch, flowing drinks, and non-stop entertainment, this is your chance to celebrate the queens who made music history—with a little drag magic on top!
Ticket Price includes: Access to the Event 2 x Drink Tokens 1x Meal from below Drinks available with Tokens: Cocktails Bottled Beer Non Alcoholic Drinks Food Options include: Fish & Chips Sirloin Steak & Fries Falafel Fusion Burger (GF) Garden Burger (Beef patty | Cheese | Lettuce | Tomato | Gherkins | Sriracha mayo | fries | Brioche bun) Southern Fried Chicken Burger (Fried Chicken Breast | Bacon | Cheddar Cheese | Lettuce | Tomato | gochujang sauce | Brioche Bun | Fries) *Smaller groups may be seated at a table with another group to maximise space available.

id: P & K’s - Bangers and Brews-P&K's Martinborough, 14 Jellicoe Street, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: P & K’s - Bangers and Brews
venue: P&K's Martinborough, 14 Jellicoe Street, Martinborough
description:
Come and enjoy an evening of Martinborough’s finest!
Taste a selection of locally made sausages (bangers) paired with craft beers from our own region.
It’s a celebration of the best local flavors, perfect for food and beer lovers alike.
Free event Wet weather option and good weather we will be in the carpark.

id: Quiz Night-7 Bar, 3 King St, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: 7 Bar, 3 King St, Upper Hutt
description:
Come join us for the weekly ritual on a Wednesday night, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Wednesday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!
The quiz kicks off at 7pm and runs for roughly 2 hours.
So, grab your buddies and come on down and join us for one of Upper Hutt's best quiz nights – 7 Bar style!

id: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Many people believe they’re eating healthily, yet still experience fatigue, inflammation, and discomfort.
Why is that?
In this workshop, you’ll explore food as medicine and gain insight into how to eat in a way that restores vitality, supports digestion, and balances your energy naturally.
What you’ll learn – The energetic qualities of different foods – How to identify which foods suit your constitution best – The ideal times to eat during the day and why timing matters – How TCM views food as fuel for both physical health and life force Whether you're curious about Eastern approaches to wellness or looking for practical tools to support your health, this workshop will offer a fresh and meaningful perspective on your relationship with food.
Meet Jinfeng, your host As a scholarly well-being practitioner with a long history of family heritage (great grandfather and father), Dr. Jinfeng has been practicing Taoist Qigong and Buddhism Great Awakening Zen Meditation to sharpen her own sense and boost her own physical vitality.

id: Thyme Well Spent: a Herb-infused Afternoon-Longbush Cottage, 1023 Longbush Road, Carterton-Event Finder
name: Thyme Well Spent: a Herb-infused Afternoon
venue: Longbush Cottage, 1023 Longbush Road, Carterton
description:
Nestle into the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse for a mindful winter afternoon of watercolour nature journaling.
Surrounded by the subtle beauty of the winter garden, you’ll be guided to sketch and paint seasonal herbs like rosemary, thyme, and sage, learning techniques to capture detail and texture in your journal.
This peaceful session is perfect for slowing down and reconnecting with nature through art.
Sip on bubbles and savour warm rosemary focaccia with herb-infused oil as you work.
No experience required — just bring a curious eye and a love of seasonal beauty.

id: The Warratahs-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
name: The Warratahs
venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
description:
The legendary Warratahs make a welcome return to the village to present their beautiful new album "Burning Daylight" along with familiar gems from their previous albums.
Featuring Barry Saunders' songs and the band's unique blend of country, rockabilly and folk, these pioneering icons and their renowned crack musicianship never fail to deliver a fantastic show with a rocking night out guaranteed.
*Tix $40 at www.undertheradar.co.nz (from Monday 23 June) *Text/call 0272584251 for phone bookings *Cash only please for door sales (if any available) *Doors 7pm, show 7.30pm *BYO See less

id: Quiz Night-Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
description:
It's the famous Worth It Wednesday Quiz Night at The Camby!
Come down for Wellington’s longest-running quiz, grab some mates and come down for a burger and beer for just $25!
Kicking off at 6.30pm, you and your crew will be flexing your mental clout through five rounds of big screen trivia, the Bonus Baffler, The Line Up and Last Person Standing!
There’s a bunch of prizes to be won, so you’ll need to bring your A-game on quiz night to succeed!
Follow the Facebook pages for updates and new quiz dates for 2025!

id: Sunday Jazz-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Sunday Jazz
venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
description:
Join us for live jazz every Sunday!
Relax in the charming bohemian olde world atmosphere of the Undercurrent and enjoy the suave musical stylings of The Undercurrent All-Stars.
Expect to hear the swinging tunes made famous by the great jazz musicians of the 1940's and 50's.
This Sunday ft. TBC!
Doors at 3pm/ Gig at 3:30pm.

id: Anyone Can Draw - Observational - Morning-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Anyone Can Draw - Observational - Morning
venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
description:
In this day time 8 week cause you will learn to create a realistic drawing from what you see.
This introductory class teaches the technical skills of observational drawing using a variety of media, including pen and ink, charcoal, pencil and pastel.
Students will learn a range of formal skills through exercises in the following: Quality of line Accurate observation of shape Gesture drawing Use of negative and positive shapes Using tone well Direct observation of spaces such as interiors, buildings or landscapes With expert guidance from Denise you will learn a broad range of skills that can serve as a basis for advancing into classes in painting and assist and finding your own means of expression.
All materials provided.

id: Distilled Comedy – One Last Pour Before Spring Blooms.-The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
name: Distilled Comedy – One Last Pour Before Spring Blooms.
venue: The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu
description:
One Last Pour Before Spring Blooms?
Get ready for a wild night of laughs (and possibly some well-meaning trainwrecks) at The Bond Store, Kapiti, Wednesday 6th August.
12 comedians, 5 minutes each, open mic style.
Like speed dating, but for jokes – if you don’t like one, wait five minutes and try again.
Come for the laughs.

id: Vagina Dry: Vagtastic Voyage-Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Vagina Dry: Vagtastic Voyage
venue: Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
Pōnoke!
Wellington!
First show of the north island line up at Valhalla with Lavendermenacesucks and No Sector.
To celebrate our final single release: privileged man.
Tickets available now on UTR.

id: Italian Film Festival 2025-Regent 3 Cinemas, 230 Queen Street, Masterton-Event Finder
name: Italian Film Festival 2025
venue: Regent 3 Cinemas, 230 Queen Street, Masterton
description:
The Italian Film Festival NZ returns to Masterton’s Regent 3 Cinema, bringing two glorious weeks of passion, laughter, romance, and cinematic brilliance to the big screen from 14 to 27 July 2025.
Now celebrating its 10th spectacular year, the festival showcases the very best of contemporary and classic Italian cinema — from timeless masterpieces to exciting new voices.
Whether you're a seasoned Italophile or just in need of a winter escape, this is your ticket to La Dolce Vita.
Opening Night – Monday 14 July, 6.30pm Join us for GLORIA!, a bold and joyful story of rebellious young musicians reimagining classical music.
We wish to share with you a celebration of Italy's storytelling, passion, and rich cultural heritage.

id: Book Launch - liz breslin: 'Show You’re Working Out'-Book Haven, 160 Riddiford St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Book Launch - liz breslin: 'Show You’re Working Out'
venue: Book Haven, 160 Riddiford St, Wellington
description:
We're pleased to be hosting on 6 August at 6pm in the shop, the Te Whanganui-a-Tara launch of liz breslin's third poem collection: 'show you’re working out.'
It has poems about scissors, Pilates, reality tv, colonisation, composting the patriarchy, Sharon from the Speights ads, women on bicycles, sharks, viral dresses and more.
liz breslin is a queer, tangata Tiriti writer, editor, performer and facilitator of Polish, Irish and English descent.
Matariki Bennett will also be doing a couple of poems at the launch, and H-J Kilkelly will introduce the book.
And the absolutely awesome cover is by Jess Hinerangi

id: NZ Sign Language - Introductory Level 1A-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: NZ Sign Language - Introductory Level 1A
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
For beginners who have no prior knowledge of NZ Sign Language.
Discounted fee of $109 for NZ citizens and residents - ID required.
Description By the end of the course, you'll be able to communicate in basic sign language and will be able to: - Introduce yourself, greet other people and exchange personal information - Demonstrate strategies for: getting attention, asking for clarification, correction and repetition - Demonstrate the finger spelling alphabet - Use numbers (0 – 20) and simple time phrases - Express basic needs and wants - Use a basic signing vocabulary Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Beeswax Candle Making-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Beeswax Candle Making
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Come along and find out how easy it is to make your very own beeswax candles to give your home a delightful ambience!
Join Jill in this 2-hour workshop where you will learn how to make three different styles of these candles using beeswax sheets.
These are great for gifting as well!
All materials included in course fee, bring a pen and paper to take notes if you wish.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Make three styles of candles Know where to source wax and wick to continue making your own at home Be proud of a home-made product created with your own hands Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever Show-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Best of the Bee Gees Saturday Night Fever Show
venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
description:
You should be dancing when the disco era comes alive on stage in Wellington.
Released in 1977, the album defined a disco generation.
Special guests Debora McLane (niece of the Bee Gees) and Roslyn Loxton join the tribute band on stage.
The album ‘Saturday Night Fever’ was the biggest-selling sound recording between 1977 and 1980.
It was awarded Album of the Year at the 1979 Grammys and stayed in the Top 200 for 29 consecutive months.

id: Indian Homestyle Cooking-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Indian Homestyle Cooking
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Not Kiwi “Indian” takeaways but real Indian food like they cook at home in Manjula’s native Gujarat!
Description Cooking: Indian Homestyle Delicious traditional Indian dishes (not based on ghee and cream!)
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Discuss the flavours and spices used in Indian and Gujarati cuisine - Know where to purchase ingredients for a selection of vegetarian and meat dishes and finger food - Read and follow a range of recipes step-by-step - Create a range of classic dishes from Southern and Northern India as cooked at home All ingredients included in course fee.
Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups.
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

id: Dried Flower Wreath Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Dried Flower Wreath Workshop
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Come and learn how to make a dried flower wreath (25-30cm wide) with Red Ruth from Bloomin Heck Wreaths.
Enrol with a family member or friend or come and make new friends!
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

id: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Writers on Mondays: Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems 2024
venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
description:
Join editor and poet Nick Ascroft as he introduces a crackling selection of New Zealand poets from his edition of the annual online anthology Ōrongohau | Best New Zealand Poems.
James Brown, Robin Peace, Simon Sweetman, Stacey Teague, Philomena Johnson, Kiri Piahana-Wong, Zephyr Zhang, and others will read their work, and poems by the late Fleur Adcock, Vincent O’Sullivan, and Paula Harris will also be celebrated in this warm-up to Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

id: Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Negotiation Skills for Successful Outcomes
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
(NZ citizens and residents free with ID, others pay $100).
To arm you with the strategies, skills, and mindset to walk into any negotiation and leave with the outcome you desire.
Own the Room: Master the art of negotiation strategy, use space to your advantage, and know the unspoken rules.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
GST NZ Residents and Citizens $0.00 incl.

id: Pottery - Handbuilding Basics-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Pottery - Handbuilding Basics
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Understand shrinkage and clay care, joining techniques, drape and press moulding, mark making, slip making and application - as well as tetrahedron, cone and cylinder production The techniques learnt during the making will provide an excellent springboard to creating a wide array of ceramic objects in the future.
Pottery courses are held at Wellington Potters' Association, 130 Grant Road, Thorndon.
All our courses are scheduled up to a year in advance which means the at times we may need to make changes to the original schedule.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
incl.

id: The Carterton Monster Annual Book Fair-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
name: The Carterton Monster Annual Book Fair
venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
description:
Calling all bookworms and avid readers!
Join us at the 2025 Carterton Monster Annual Book Fair!
We have thousands of books looking for new homes!
Treat your shelves to some fantastic reading material.
All the money raised goes back to the community.

id: Samoan - Introductory 2-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Samoan - Introductory 2
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
For those who have completed Samoan - Introductory 1 recently or have equivalent knowledge.
Discounted fee of $99 for NZ citizens and residents.
For those who have done Introductory 1 (16 hours) or have equivalent knowledge e.g. who may have picked up some basic survival language through travel.
By the end of the course, you will: - Build on the language and grammar skills learned in the Introductory 1 course - Have sufficient grammar and vocabulary to conduct a basic conversation in Samoan on everyday topics - Be able to describe and use (at a basic level) correct sentence structure in Samoan - Be able to describe traditional Samoan protocols and use these in practice 8 weeks, Thur 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM Wellington High School Presented by Elizabeth Solomona From $99 incl.
GST

id: Floral Watercolour-Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: Floral Watercolour
venue: Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough
description:
This one’s for our lovely locals- who support Ventana year-round and keep the creative spirit alive in our community.
Join us for a relaxed evening of watercolour painting, where we’ll explore loose, expressive floral designs.
This workshop is all about play, flow, and colour- no perfection required.
Whether you’re a beginner or just looking for a creative reset, you’ll leave with a page full of beautiful blooms and a refreshed sense of joy.

id: Monthly Jazz Night: Lisa Tomlins-The Thistle Inn, 3 Mulgrave St, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Monthly Jazz Night: Lisa Tomlins
venue: The Thistle Inn, 3 Mulgrave St, Thorndon, Wellington
description:
Experience an unforgettable Friday night at The Thistle Inn with our Jazz Special!
We're thrilled to have the remarkable Lisa Tomlins back on stage, ready to captivate you with her mesmerising talent and stunning vocals.
Prepare for a night filled with soulful melodies and irresistible rhythms, as Lisa's beautiful sound fills the room and sets the perfect ambiance for an evening to remember.
Mark your calendars for a jazz-filled night you won't want to miss!

id: The Joy of Improvisation-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Joy of Improvisation
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Discover your creative potential and enjoy improvising scenes and stories in a safe, positive group environment with the Wellington Improvisation Troupe [WIT].
This is the perfect place for absolute beginners to get acquainted with the joy and art of improvisation, inspired by the generous creative philosophy of Keith Johnstone.
It uses fun games and structured exercises to teach the foundation skills of improv.
These are a prerequisite for further courses and membership of WIT (www.wit.org.nz), as well as useful in themselves.
By the end of the course, you'll have: - Explored basic principles of improvisation - Enjoyed interacting in a friendly, positive and supportive environment - Developed more confidence, presentation and communication skills - Experienced joyful moments of improvisation The course will end with a directed demonstration of class exercises for invited friends and family.

id: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth
venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
description:
It’s a mindset that doesn't serve your purpose.
Join us for the next workshop in our Habits Mastery Series: In this interactive 1-hour workshop, you’ll learn: How your beliefs shape your habits and outcomes The difference between a fixed and growth mindset How to shift your internal dialogue and self-image Tools to break limiting beliefs and unlock your potential “Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t — you’re right.” — Henry Ford Walk away with practical tools, inspiring insights, and the motivation to think bigger about your life.
Meet your host, Nava Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud.
Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life.
Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life.

id: Creative Mindfulness-Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough-Event Finder
name: Creative Mindfulness
venue: Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough
description:
Step away from the noise and into a space of calm and creativity.
In this gentle, guided workshop, we’ll explore simple yet powerful art-based mindfulness practices designed to help you slow down, reconnect with yourself, and find presence through making.
Using a mix of mark-making, colour exploration, and intuitive drawing, you’ll be encouraged to let go of outcomes and tune into the process—no pressure, no perfection, just peaceful creativity.
This special locals’ offering is a small thank you to those who continue to support Ventana and value the power of art to soothe and restore.

id: The Warratahs-The Thistle Inn, 3 Mulgrave St, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
name: The Warratahs
venue: The Thistle Inn, 3 Mulgrave St, Thorndon, Wellington
description:
The Thistle Inn proudly present one of New Zealand's most Iconic bands for one night only.
A special new album release show- "Burning Daylight".
You might hear the odd cover but really its the sound that The Warratahs have made their own and its become part of the NZ landscape.
Poetic lyrics skidding along on an exciting blend of accordion, fiddle drums, guitars and singing.
$40 General Admission - Doors open 7pm $100 includes 2 course dinner, a glass of bubbly & show - 6.30pm Dinner will be served in our private dining rooms.

id: Candle Making Workshop-Wellington Candle Co., Queen Charlotte Drive, Aotea, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
name: Candle Making Workshop
venue: Wellington Candle Co., Queen Charlotte Drive, Aotea, Porirua - Mana
description:
Unleash Your Inner Candle Maker Join us for a relaxing and creative workshop where you'll learn how to make your own beautiful, hand-poured candles.
Our expert guides will walk you through every step of the process, from selecting fragrances to creating stunning designs.
What's included: - All materials provided, including soy wax, wicks, fragrance oils, dyes, and containers - Step-by-step instruction from experienced candle makers - Refreshments to enjoy during the workshop - A finished candle to take home Workshop Details: - Duration: 2 hours - Limited Spaces: Only 7 spots available per session - Child Supervision: Children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult Upcoming Workshops: - Sunday, February 2nd, 2025, at 2 PM - Sunday, March 2nd, 2025, at 2 PM - Sunday, April 6th, 2025, at 2 PM - Sunday, May 4th, 2025, at 2 PM **Book your spot now!
** More details on our Website

id: Menstrual Mates-Te Aro Zero Waste @ Sustainability Trust, 2 Forresters Lane, CBD, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Menstrual Mates
venue: Te Aro Zero Waste @ Sustainability Trust, 2 Forresters Lane, CBD, Wellington
description:
We’ve partnered with Wellington Timebank in the fight against period poverty.
Please drop in for a morning of making reusable period products, kōrero and empowerment.
There is opportunity for everyone to get involved and experience is not necessary.
Tea, coffee and baking provided.

id: Qi Gong-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Qi Gong
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Qi gong, pronounced “chi gong,” was developed in China thousands of years ago as part of traditional Chinese medicine.
Qigong has both psychological and physical components and involves the regulation of the mind, breath, and body’s movement and posture.
In most forms of qigong: Breath is slow, long, and deep.
Breath patterns may switch from abdominal breathing to breathing combined with speech sounds.
Dynamic (active) qigong techniques primarily focus on body movements, especially movements of the whole body or arms and legs.

id: Retirement Reinvented-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Retirement Reinvented
venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
description:
Whether you’re already retired, or planning ahead, this practical workshop will help you to reflect, re-envision and re-vitalise your life and develop a plan for your future, on your own terms.
(NZ citizen and residents free with ID, all others pay $109).
What’s next?
After the workshop, you’ll be able to identify a number of common issues and potential ways to manage them when considering and planning your “rejuvenation”, rather than a retirement.
By the end of the day, you’ll have: - Developed your own perspective on ageing and retirement in the 21st Century and identified what’s important to you - Completed a personal life audit exercise and considered your strengths - Explored possibilities in the major aspects of your life and identified potential challenges and strategies for overcoming them - Developed a blueprint to maximise the best years of your life and developed a “future proofing” downsizing plan - Considered options to include a sense of purpose and explored and implemented choices that provide you with that sense of purpose Bring a pen and paper.

id: Tonga Language Week Flag Raising Ceremony-Te Rauparaha Park, Norrie Street, Porirua, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
name: Tonga Language Week Flag Raising Ceremony
venue: Te Rauparaha Park, Norrie Street, Porirua, Porirua - Mana
description:
Uike Kātoanga’i ‘o e lea faka-Tonga – Tonga Language Week Celebrate: 17 - 23 August 2025 You are invited to join the formal flag raising ceremony, at the Peace Memorial in Te Rauparaha Park.
This event is weather dependant and will be moved to the performing arts space at Pātaka if raining.
The flag raising ceremony will also be morning tea and refreshments at Pātaka after the ceremony.
Find out more about the Pacific Language Weeks here: https://poriruacity.govt.nz/your-council/pacific-culture-in-porirua-city/pacific-language-weeks/

id: Sunday Jazz - Callum Allardice-The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Sunday Jazz - Callum Allardice
venue: The Rogue and Vagabond, 18 Garrett St, Wellington
description:
The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz.
Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz.
Beer and jazz, on a Sunday perfect!
This week featuring local guitarist Callum Allardice and his trio Join the Callum Allardice trio for some favourite standards and standard inspired originals, featuring the talents of John Rae and Eli Mulheron.
Music from 5pm FREE ENTRY, koha for the band encouraged

id: Quiz Night-Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
name: Quiz Night
venue: Cambridge Hotel, 28 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
description:
Looking for the perfect midweek hangout?
Join us for QUIZ NIGHTS every Wednesday at 6:30 PM at The Bridge!
Round up your mates and take on the challenge for a night full of fun, good vibes, and friendly competition.
Enjoy our special $29 Burger & Drink deal while you put your knowledge to the test.
Gather your squad and head over to 28 Cambridge Terrace this Wednesday at 6:30 PM—don't miss out on the fun!
